docs.title: GA4GH Beacon project
docs.text:
New Site

The new site can be reached through geneomebeacons.org. This site is just a legacy placeholder.

Technical Documentation

Please visit docs.geneomebeacons.org for technical and implementation details.

docs.title: Protocols and Minutes
docs.text: The Beacon project organizes one monthly GA4GH Beacon call (which focuses on the specification), and one monthly ELIXIR Beacon call (which focuses on the implementation). In addition, we put together several working groups (or "scouts") that focus on specific aspects of Beacon. Following the "open & transparent" approach of GA4GH, the meeting minutes and outputcan be accessed either as archives or rolling documents.

docs.title: Beacon Documentation Team
docs.text: The Beacon Documentation Scout develops documentation more easily browsable by clinical partners and researchers.

docs.title: Beacon Genomic Variants Team
docs.text:
The Genomic Variants Team evaluates "structural" types of genomic variants with respect to their representation & query through current & future versions of the Beacon API. This scope intersects with work being pursued in the ELIXIR h-CNV community and considers standards under development by the GA4GH GKS workstream.

Every three weeks, GV scout members meet to document genomic variants use cases and query examples.

docs.title: Genomic Variants TC
docs.text:
• Genomic variants: use cases and examples (working document)
  • Meeting minutes

docs.title: Beacon  GA4GH API — Discovery work stream
docs.text: These are the minutes for the Beacon API Sub Group of the GA4GH Discovery Work Stream. For further information, please visit the GA4GH Work Stream page. This call happens every second Tuesday of the month.

docs.title: Beacon Compliance Team
docs.text: The Beacon Compliance Team develops tests & tools for evaluating the query compliance of Beacon implementations.

docs.title: Johan Viklund, Malin Klang, Andreas Kähäri, Michael Baudis, Marta Ferri
Agenda
docs.text:
• Current test suite status.
  • How is test data stored and loaded into a beacon.

docs.title: Todo
docs.text:
• Format of test data.
    • Define individual call sets (i.e. a variant that is twice should be twice in test data)
  • How to interpret the API. Different sites have had different interpretation on how queries and the response should be formatted. We need to go through these and agree.
  • Structure tests into different classes.
  • How new queries are added to the API and compliance tests - to be discussed in a bigger setting.

docs.title: Beacon Filters Team Minutes 2020
docs.text: The Beacon Filters Team develops tests & tools for evaluating the query compliance of Beacon implementations.
